1.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before

2.brief: to tie fast; hence (of the mouth) to be tongue-tied
stillness; adverbially, silently; abstractly quiet, trust

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
properly, to roil water; figuratively, to disturb or affict

3.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)

4.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an extremity; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) after
properly, extension, i.e. height or breadth; also a measure (including its standard); hence a portion (as measured) or a vestment; specifically, tribute (as measured)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
life (as a fleeting portion of time); hence, the world (as transient)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively)

6.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
a phantom, i.e. (figuratively) illusion, resemblance; hence, a representative figure, especially an idol
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)

7.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

8.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

9.brief: to tie fast; hence (of the mouth) to be tongue-tied
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

10.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a blow (figuratively, infliction); also (by implication) a spot (concretely, a leprous person or dress)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)

11.brief: chastisement; figuratively (by words) correction, refutation, proof (even in defence)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct

a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

12.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
near, with or among; often in general, to
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, a guest; by implication, a foreigner
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application

properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to break off or loose (in a favorable or unfavorable sense), i.e. desist (from grief) or invade (with destruction)
properly, non-occurrence; used adverbially, not yet or before
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
